hackathon-eligibility:
Engineers, designers, managers,marketers, students, non-students!
Anyone with an idea and the drive to realise it is welcome!
hackathon-requirements: Submit your projects due Sunday March 25th at 12.30pm. One team member submits the project and adds other team members to the submission afterwards. The submission can be freely edited after submitting. Remember to fill up the correct table number and inform all the tracks and challenges you attended.
hackathon-rules:
The most creative hacks win!
You can find their judging criteria on the 
 websites.
Generally the judging criteria can be described as: 
- Originality and uniqueness
- Technical aspects of hack
- Quality of pitch / demo / prototype

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Terrada, our track partner, believes that it’s time to move away from the traditional business model of “depositing things and storing them in a warehouse” to building business models that create new value by utilizing data of real goods and freight.

Cogent labs, one of Junction Tokyo’s main partners, believes that AI can help solve the problems which have been labeled as unsolvable. Solving these problems will create a new impact on the society, so that man and machine can co-exist in a codependent relationship.

Almost all modern vehicles are equipped with multiple communication networks called CAN that ECUs which are used to exchange a myriad of data; critical to maintaining the correct operation and safety of the vehicle. Intrepid provides professional hardware & software tools that make those data available to you so that you can build your own automotive applications.
BOSCH, Junction Tokyo’s technical partner, has equipped their challenge with their game changing XDK kit. Or as we like to call it, XDK: The “Swiss army knife” for the Internet of Things.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2 Chome-6-10 Higashishinagawa, Shinagawa-ku, Tōkyō-to 140-0002, Japan
hackathon-description-header: Held annually, Junction Tokyo is the most international hackathon in Japan and a melting pot for developers, designers, and entrepreneurs from around the world.
